explanation: Agent A is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires that a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible. In the function de is only used for reading (de->d_name and de->d_name[0]) and is never used to modify the dirent object, so it can and should be declared as a pointer to a const-qualified type (e.g. "const struct dirent *de"). Assigning the result of readdir (which returns struct dirent *) to a const-qualified pointer is allowed without a cast, so making this change is safe in this code path. (If elsewhere the pointer is used to modify the object or passed to APIs that require a non-const pointer, those uses would prevent making it const.)
